results.name: Least k >= 1 such that k^n + n is prime, or 0 if no such k exists.
comment: Because the polynomial x^n + n is reducible for n in A097792, a(27) and a(64) are 0. Although x^4 + 4 is reducible, the factor x^2 - 2x + 2 is 1 for x=1. - _T. D. Noe_, Aug 24 2004
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..756
mathematica: Table[If[MemberQ[{27, 64}, n], 0, k=1; While[ !PrimeQ[k^n+n], k++ ]; k], {n, 100}]
a[n_] := If[!okQ[n], 0, s = 1; While[!PrimeQ[s^n + n], s++]; s];
program: a(n) = if (!isok(n), 0, my(s=1); while(!isprime(s^n+n), s++); s); \\ adapted by _Michel Marcus_, Jan 15 2019
xref: Cf. A097792 (n such that x^n + n is reducible).
